overview_of_class: This course is the third and final course in general chemistry, the continuation of CHEM 101 and CHEM 102. Topics covered include equilibria in aqueous solutions: acid-base, complex ions, solubility equilibria; electrochemistry and oxidation-reduction reactions; chemical kinetics; descriptive chemistry: representative elements and industrial processes; coordination chemistry; introduction to organic and biomolecules; special topics.
name: General Physical Chemistry
title: SCS CHEM 103-CN-65 General Physical Chemistry
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 123-CN.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is the third and final course in general chemistry, the continuation of CHEM 101 and CHEM 102. Topics covered include equilibria in aqueous solutions: acid-base, complex ions, solubility equilibria; electrochemistry and oxidation-reduction reactions; chemical kinetics; descriptive chemistry: representative elements and industrial processes; coordination chemistry; introduction to organic and biomolecules; special topics.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Grade of C- or higher in CHEM 102 or equivalent course, or consent of instructor.
Students must enroll in CHEM 123 (lab), and the associated discussion section.

subject: CHEM
